document_data.name: Skeeve Stabwell
document_data.mainbody:
'''Skeeve Stabwell''' was a member of [[The Guild]] from the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''Who let you through? Tusgront? Bloody idiot. I'd go inside if I were you. 'Fore we change our minds.''|Skeeve Stabwell}}
document_data.Description: Skeeve was a [[human]] with with golden hair and bronze skin. He had gray eyes and face, concealed by a mask. Like other members of the Guild, Skeeve wore [[leather armor|leathers]] dyed with the organization's emerald colors.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, Skeeve Stabwell was tasked with standing guard of the secret entrance into Baldur's Gate's [[Undercellar]] where The Guild's Guildhall was hidden. Whilst a [[half-orc]]ish enforcer [[Tusgront]] manned the main entrance, Skeeve was ready to dispatch of any unwanted guest from a distance.
